document.heading: School Transit Subsidy Act of 1978 Amendment Act of 1998

history.narrative: Law 12-156, the “School Transit Subsidy Act of 1978 Amendment Act of 1998,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 12-190, which was referred to the Committee on Public Works and the Environment. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on May 5, 1998, and June 2, 1998, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on June 17, 1998, it was assigned Act No. 12-383 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 12-156 became effective on October 7, 1998.
